msbt.message: That reminds me, have you tried our locally-grown, island-to-table organic fruit yet?
I have!
No, tell me more!
Oh, wellof course you have! You've got good taste.
Oh MAN! You're really missing out. You've gotta try the we grow here, ! Take one back to wherever you're from and tell 'em sent it.

I gotta say, I'm pretty interested to see how this little shop evolves.Like, right now it's just a small corner of Tom Nook's tent, but will it grow into a legit shopping center? I certainly hope so, for my sake!
I'm so happy about what Timmy and Tommy have done with Nook's Cranny here. From a hole-in-the-wall joint to a real classy shop with a wide selection of designer goods It's a dream come true!

Nook's Cranny is truly the pride and joy of . Shopping there can be life-changing. Seriously, it's great! It might even have items you've never seen on any other island. Shopping is believing, so don't take my word for it.

Have you stopped by Blathers's tent yet? It's the closest thing has to a museum. I mean, it's nothing fancyfor now. But I bet one day he'll turn it into something really special. Imagine it with meâ€”a grand hall packed to the rafters with wonders of the world I can't wait!

Who's got an impeccable sense of style and recommends the Museum? This guy! It's such a great place to clear your head and learn about our world. Plus, when it's empty, it makes my singing voice sound amaaaaazing!
Did you know that the museum has a rare in its collection? You should go check it out. That fish has more swag than 99 percent of the land-based folks I know!
I got a really weird feeling at the exhibit in the museum. It's likeam I watching it, or is it watching ME?!
Hey, have you already seen the display at the museum? It's so cool to see the skeleton of an actual creature that lived millions of years ago. I hope my bones get their own exhibit someday
Hey, can I ask you something that's, like, serious business?Have you ever thought about me, you know, since I moved away?
Of course!
To be honest, no.
Did you miss me?
AwwI feel the same way. Well, the good news is that you can come see me anytime, !

Hey, thanks for being honest. If I want to get my brand where I want it to be, I need feedback like that. And I suppose you had no choice but to find some way, however difficult, to fill that giant void I left behind.

Hey, I asked you first! <10_4 />Ah, but I can't resist your cheeky charm, so I'll actually answer. I did miss you! Not to get weepy or anything, but I'll always treasure the memories I have with you. OK, we've gotta talk about something else now or I'm gonna lose it.
Hey, have you heard about the latest trend sweeping the island?

It's fishing in the ocean!I mean, sure, fishing has been around forever, but it's recently back in vogue. There's something about gazing out over the sparkling sea while reeling in a catch that's so satisfying

It's catching bugs!Yeah, I know folks have been catching bugs forever, but have you SEEN the cool bugs out there lately? Some of those things look like they should have a designer label on them. Ha HA!

It's digging holes!Now, hear me out. I know it just sounds like a good way to get dirt on your brand-new faux-suede boots. But when you dig holes, it's like you're re-imagining the very landscape of our island! I find it to be one of the most creative things you can do

It's gardening!Sure, we've been planting and tending to plants for ages. But not like this! First, you plant the plants. Then, and here's the magical part, you water them!Wait. That IS how we've been doing it all along?
